content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for the function `clean_column`.

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)  # convert to lower case
    col = replace(col, r"[-\s]+", "_")  # replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    return col
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as an input. The `lowercase` function is used to convert all the uppercase letters in the string into lowercase. The `replace` function is used to find and replace any sequences of one or more white spaces with single underscore. Finally, we return the cleaned column name.
